result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaitlyn Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with 16CF320.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Bond from 16CF320 & 16CF269 applied  -  PAID IN FULL

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Cash bond posted shall be applied.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.   
*  Perform  80  hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.   
May not have contact with K-Mart or Kohl's Stores, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  
Credit for 1 day if revoked.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. Defendant, Kaitlyn  Scott, appeared with Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved. DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI is waived by parties and sentencing arguments are made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions and is Concurrent with 16CF320.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  DE's driving privileges are suspended for 6 months.  Court costs is ordered and cash bond on deposit in 16CF269 is to be applied along with any remaining balance of bond in16CF320.  If any unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Minutes:  15CF1226/16CF269/16CF320.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Offer relayed recently; defense counsel reports the case will likely be settled - will be meeting w/the deft next week.  Plea/sentencing set for 8/26/16 @ 9:15am.
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Carl Johnson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case trails 16CF320.  Status conf. 8/11/16 at 8:45.  Bond continued.
Motion hearing on July 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Motion Hearing is canceled for today and will be rescheduled due to a continued motion in another case.  Motion Hearing rescheduled to 7/12/16 at 10:00 AM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Kaitlyn  Scott, appeared with Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson. Clerk: PT
Atty Johnson has filed a motion to suppress in 16CF320 so this case will trail.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Kaitlyn  Scott, appeared with Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Clerk: PT
Atty Johnson states he just received discovery from Joint Services and requests an adjournment; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clerk: PT
Atty Johnson states DE was arrested last night and is facing new charges at 1PM today so he is requesting an adjournment.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Carl Johnson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Johnson requests time to review the video with def.  FPT adj. to 3/10/16 at 8:50.  Bond continued.

Defendant, Kaitlyn Scott, appeared with Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
